name: Suite Novotel Calais Coquelles Tunnel sous La Manche

reviews.text: the toilet smelt like a mens toilet in a bar...not good when when traveling with a female
reviews.title: toilet facility in the room...

reviews.text: this needs to be addressed......the room was spacitious and good valur for money, could be more tea/coffee available...
reviews.title: frequent traveller

reviews.text: I think bigger beds or twin beds please as the beds are too small for 2 persons and the breakfast is too expensive for what little is on offer but generally the rooms are a good size and clean and the bathrooms are clean as well but it is not easy to get a good nights sleep because of the bed size and they are a bit hard and the pillows lumpy
reviews.title: Staying in Calais?

reviews.text: You will not find a better hotel for the money!! It was clean, the room was very big. It was modern and bright. We stayed here for one night and really enjoyed it. There was free internet access in the hotel lobby. They had vending machines in the lobby with food of all kinds in them.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't imagine there being a better value hotel in the calais area that one could stay in.
reviews.title: Perfect for a shopping trip

reviews.text: It is next to a huge new shopping complex. It is not plush but in almost every other respect it was excellent!!
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a pre-christmas shopping trip as is directly opposite the Cite Europe shopping centre. We booked a disabled room which was on the ground floor. (There are lifts to other floors). The room was spacious with the TV and large table on castors which could be easily moved around to accomodate a wheelchair. The bathroom was a 'wet room' style, again with plenty of space. Our room overlooked the secure car park so our car was parked almost directly outside our window. The room had a fridge, small sink and microwave. Ready meals are available from a fridge next to the reception although I bought ours in the supermarket. Disposable plates and cutlery are freely available from the same place as the ready meals. There are Tea & Coffee making facilities in the room. Breakfast is a self service buffet (eat as much as you like) designed to eat in, take away or take back to your room. You can also have breakfast delivered to your room. The there is a small bar (which doubles as the breakfast room). Despite being 200m from the A16 motorway it could not be heard at all - even at the dead of night. The TV has French, English (BBC1,2 & ITV), German & Italian channels. Check in and Check out is is 12.00. I would recommend this hotel, particularly for it's disabled access.
reviews.title: Great for Families!

likes.disliked: — Having to wait for our room to be cleaned.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled with my husband and our son, he wanted privacy and company! and this hotel provided that. Large room with a screen for privacy, bathroom and sep toilet very handy, fridge and microwave. Beds are firm but that didn'y bother us, pillows were too squishy for us but thats our problem. Room and hotel very clean, staff charming. Our gripes were: paid extra for 3rd person but still had to ask for towels, cups etc! Breakfast was horrible and expensive at 12 euros go to the Ibis next door and pay 7 1/2 euros for much better food. That aside still a good value clean safe location especially if you'd rather keep an eye on your childen, will use again
reviews.title: Superb start and end for French tour

reviews.text: We stopped here very late after taking the chunnel, with our two kids. Check in at 1am was quick and easy, its a 24 hour operation like the chunnel itself (we were not the only arrivals then). Room was as usual for the Suitenovotel, stylish and well designed, we all slept fine. Breakfast again as usual, not the full buffet but pleasant and different (the Suitnovotels seems remarkably consistent). Only difficulty was finding the hotel by car, the hotel area isn't signed when you drive out and in the dark it took us a few false turns and 15 mins drive to fine, even though when we arrived we could see the tunnel entrance from our room so use the sat nav if unfamaliar with the route. There are three hotels in the same place, this the Ibis and Etap, this lookest nicest but to be honest for a one night stop you'll probably be ok at any!
reviews.title: convenient stopover

reviews.text: This new, modern, well designed hotel is a cut above the usual budget hotels in Calais. It's very functional and practical, handy for the tunnel with free wifi and loads of secure parking which was an issue for us with a car full of stuff from a month on the road touring Europe. The location is a bit bleak though; the no man's land out by the tunnel is somewhat soul destroying. There's no restaurant in the hotel and the nearby Cite d'Europe complex has all the charm of an airport departure lounge. Driving into Calais was the only option for dinner that would preserve our sanity.
reviews.title: a cut above the norm for Calais

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Suite Novotel in Calais because we arrived quite late at night and we felt it was the most convenient and comfortable place to stopover for one night as we were heading to Normandy the next morning.
reviews.title: Convenient & Comfortable

reviews.text: The staff on arrival and departure were welcoming, and found the young man serving breakfast very helpful and amiable.
reviews.title: Perfect for one night stay

reviews.text: The room exceeded our expectations, very good bed and shower and all the little extras were a nice touch.
reviews.title: Ideal Eurotunnel hotel location

reviews.text: Having stayed here several times before, I confirm it is still a good resting point before a crossing. With 2 children, I prefer to stay here overnight, and take an early train back to England. Trundle bed, single, double, and seperate bath and shower. Kettle, microwave, and fridge. Coffee cups remain horrible, with 2 cardboard ones provided. BYO or buy from the shopping centre next door. We don't bother with their pre-packed breakfasts, preferring to purchase from either Carrefours or the Calais tunnel stores.
reviews.title: Remains a convenient and pleasant stop before Channel Tunnel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free internet available - only one terminal.
reviews.title: large comfortable room

reviews.text: We timed it badly this time - we were caught up with the Eurostar breakdowns. This didn't impact on our trip, however we got wrong information from the reception desk at the hotel. We were told that the car tunnel was not working and that we should head for the port. Luckily, we spoke to some other passengers, and worked out amongst ourselves that this information was incorrect. Would stay again, and probably will sometime.
reviews.title: Reliable and spacious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a chain experience and the decor is entirely 'identikit'. However, the rooms are large. It is clean, comfortable and excellent value. Free WiFi is included (why does the same chain charge stupid prices for WiFi in Mercure hotels?). There are limited cooking facilities in the rooms. It is near to some of the enormouus and now rather sad shopping malls. Make sure you get the detailed location before you go. It's easy to miss as you leave the Tunnel.
reviews.title: Great stopover when using the Chunnel

reviews.text: Straight out of a tent and needing space - this was just what we needed. The bathroom is separate from the toilet which is great when sharing a room 4 ways. There is a complimentary bfast but two of us went for what turned out to be the overpriced 12 euro breakfast ...nevertheless interesting.. apple crumble / little fingers of cheese and ham sandwich etc etc. But if you have fussy eaters or vegetarians amongst you, stick with the free version. Super convenient for the tunnel. Our two retrievers were welcomed (extra charge) though if going as a non-dog-owning guest, not sure I would see this as a plus!
reviews.title: A good stopover for the Tunnel

reviews.text: Only stayed 1 night but it was great, rooms where very clean and very spacious.
reviews.title: lovely stay

reviews.text: Great car park all fenced up great if you're in Calais shopping and decide to stay overnight.
reviews.title: Perfect to stop at on way to France or back to UK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every time we go back to France we stay at this hotel to break the long drive in half. Its position is perfect as it takes 2 minutes to get to it from the Tunnel and 5 to get back to it! The rooms are clean, very big (30sqm) and the bathroom have a bath and a shower. Perfect for families. The free movies are a plus especially for the kids! It is also opposite the centre de l'Europe shopping center which has lots of restaurants and great shops too!
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is not I can say other than Accor Group have certainly got it right here (see my over reviews). We stayed overnight on Thursday 25 September and from the moment we arrived we were met by friendly, professional staff in reception area. As it was a Thursday we were offered a free (clothes on) massage which we declined due to time but the thought was there.
reviews.title: Excellant value

reviews.text: This is the second time of staying (over a year ago) at the Suite Hotel Coquelles and we knew what to expect but we wondered if the room was going to be as clean and as nicely presented as last time. It was, with the addition of a large flat screen TV and a new gizmo thing for going on the internet and playing movies and music plus more which just went over my head!
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise!

likes.liked: — The room - very well thought out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is as you would expect, just next door the Channel Tunnel and the Cite d’Europe shopping mall and a few miles up the road from Calais port. So it makes it a good choice as a stopover from your journey to & from the UK but equally an ideal base for exploring the Pas de Calais. The rooms are equipped with a microwave and you are able to buy chilled microwavable meals from the refrigerated display down in the reception area. However, if you do not want to buy their food, do as we did and pop over to Carrefour in the Cite d’Europe and get your food there and bring it back to your room or find a local traiteur on route to the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: Don’t let the thought of sharing a room with a small kitchen area put you off, everything is spotlessly clean and is as it should be and the rooms are huge and well equipped. 10/10 and a credit to their management & staff.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — The staff and paying for the room twice!

reviews.title: One of the better choices in the area.
reviews.text: Having booked a hotel room close to Eurotunnel in Calais we did not expect much. When we arrived nd saw building works on the adjoining Ibis hotel we were quite concerned!
Suitehotel is incredibly convenient and handy. AT THE PRICE, the rooms are absolutely spectacular. The facilities are absolutely dead-center spot-on perfectly for the purpose.
reviews.title: The best motel in the WORLD under $1000 a night!

reviews.text: Quite simply it is the only place to stay near the Tunnel, in France. We are incredibly happy to have found it.
reviews.title: What a SUPER find!

likes.liked: — Good rooms, spacious, all very pleasant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have more time and want to spend more money, stay at the Hotel Clery mini-chateaux (which is 25 minutes away in the countryside), which is a superb hotel.
reviews.title: A Comfortable Stopover

likes.liked: — Easy access, security when carrying lots of goods in vehicle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But otherwise, there is absolutely no reason to stay anywhere other than the Suitehotel. (If you need to save the last few dollars in these tough times, choose the cheaper Ibis or Etap.)
reviews.title: Very Basic Accomodation

likes.liked: — The location - near the channel tunnel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suitehotel FACTS:
reviews.title: Great staff, hotel OK but...

likes.disliked: — smelly room and toilet, hard uncomfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading reviews of other T.A. Members, we booked a Superior Suite Over the Easter week for one night. When we arrived we were greeted by young lady at reception with a smile and a very straightforward booking in procedure. She explained the layout of the hotel and various amenities that they supply. In reception there is an automated food dispenser which allows you to purchase various meals and snacks. We decided not to go for breakfast and stayed on a room only basis, our room was on the third floor facing the car park, as we were told it was the quieter side which indeed it was. The room itself consists of table, chairs a screened sleeping area with a comfortable bed. There is also a microwave kettle and fridge. If you like your tea and coffee without using their paper cups it may well be to your advantage to bring a couple of your own mugs plates and utensils as these are not supplied in the suite. The bathroom was clean with an efficient separate shower enclosure. The toilet reminded me slightly of an aircraft style enclosure but was again clean. The television we found really useful as you can gain access to video on demand, all films can be shown in various different languages English was selected and proved very useful. English T.V. was also available. The only problem I had, was that the television displayed a clock which turned off with the television. The room has very efficient blackout blinds on the windows.so in the morning thank goodness we had brought a travel clock with us as it was difficult to determine what time it was. The car park is fenced with video cameras and good lighting. Booked via the Internet as rooms on arrival are more expensive than pre-booking. The hotel is within walking distance of the city of Europe a large shopping centre with various restaurants and a large supermarket open until 930 Monday to Wednesday 10 o'clock Thursday Friday and Saturday.In all, a good hotel and will stay there again
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: We made a late night channel crossing via the tunnel and this hotel is just a few minutes away when you arrive in France.
reviews.title: Excellent stop-off

aka: Suite Novotel Calais Coquelles Tunnel Sous La Manche Hotel Coquelles
description: 3 star hotel, 100 inviting 30sqm suites. Discover our free unlimited Suite box, high-speed Internet connection, phone calls to landlines within France, videos and music on-demand, media zone with chat, music and photos… Located on the Opal Coast, 5 minutes from the Channel Tunnel, 10 minutes from the TGV Eurostar station. Beaches and Cap Blanc Nez 10 min away. 24hr services including food counter, fitness space, business corner. Bar, free massages Thursdays, parking. Tourisme et Handicap certified.
